title: Показ российского документального фильма о причинах СВО отменили в Италии
cleaned_sentences: The mayor of the Italian city of Scratzo in Tuscan Alessandro Ginelli announced the abolition of the show of the Maidan: Turn to the War removed by Russia Today about the coup in Ukraine and the events followed in the territories of the Donetsk and Lugansk People’s Republics (DPR) and (LPR).
This was reported by the newspaper La Nazione.
The show was scheduled for January 18.

According to some reports, such a decision could be made due to the planned performance of two journalists-a military correspondent from Italy Andrea Luchidi and Vincenzo Lurusso, who translated the picture into Italian.
The organizer of the Michele Menchetti show criticized the abolition of the show.
In his opinion, in this way, the city deprives itself with a platform for debate.
Mencetti promised to find other ways to present a film, noting that interest in this topic is great.

Earlier, the actor and producer, special representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry for Russian-American humanitarian ties, Stephen Sigal, said that he was preparing a documentary about events in the zone of special military operation (SV) in Ukraine.
The tape will contain evidence that the special operation "was not an invasion of Russia, as other countries of the world, in particular, representatives of NATO and the USA say."
